instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09  No boot
threads.message:
Hi all! 
Came in this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09. No signs of corrosion, MB looks perfect.
Customer report that the machine works perfect yesterday evening, but this morning macbook won't turn on.
CPU Vcore steady at 1.07v measured on L7210/L7220 so no boot I guess.

with another bin came from this forum (filename "<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09 - clean.bin") , Vcore stays at 0v.
Where should I start?
Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09  No boot
threads.message: You can find more dumps on badcaps forum; try one and comment.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09  No boot
threads.message:
tried 5 or 6 different bin files.
I get 0v with most of them and a weird 0.85v. 
The last one that i tried led me to the same point: steady 1.08v
I'm working with board alone on my desk.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09  No boot
threads.message:
Then probably bad CPU.

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> comes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09  No boot
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> comes high after a few seconds and stay high at 3.33v stable

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09  No boot
threads.message: So nothing that I can do? :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-09  No boot
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> comes high power on sequence is completed and remains a problem related with data communication between the chips.
Just in case, check all resistors from LPC bus, <RESISTOR>R1320</RESISTOR>-7.
Also check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.
You can try to heat CPU with quality flux; in case of accumulated crap underneath.
